Html:
Hi guys am using this control in one of my projects n it works fine,

but sometimes when i start the application the Map control wont load fully 

here is the code i use to initialize the map

With myGMap
.CanDragMap = True
.MinZoom = 0
.MaxZoom = 25
.Manager.Mode = AccessMode.ServerOnly
.DragButton = Windows.Forms.MouseButtons.Left
.MouseWheelZoomType = False End With

Try
myMapProvider = GMapProviders.GoogleMap
myGMap.Cursor = Cursors.WaitCursor
myGMap.MapProvider = myMapProvider
myGMap.Cursor = Cursors.Hand
myMapOverLay = New GMapOverlay(myGMap, "myMapOverLay")
myGMap.Overlays.Add(myMapOverLay)
myGMap.Zoom = curr_zoom
myGMap.Position = New PointLatLng(8.879814, 76.605248)
Catch ex As Exception
End Try

here is the screen shot

The region in red box is were the full map should have loaded

Need help Many Thanks

set map properties before form is loaded: minzoom, maxzoom, zoom, position, provider

in form constructor

WOW it worked tanxxxxxxx a lot 

man u rock
tnx a lot u rock man am loving this control
;} thanks, if you have a problem, just call
is der any way to remove the delay in loading the map while debugging
why do you use debug build? Use release build
while debugging even if i use release buid it takes time to load :(
yea but while running the release build as stand alone there is no delay :) i guess u put that delay while debugging for some purpose

yes, debug build is for debugging, it's slow, no reason to use it

..anyway you can still debug your application while using release build from gmap.net
tanx a lot for dis control its simply AWESOM!!!!!!!!!!
